results.title: Le Vieux Fusil = the Old Gun
results.brief_description:
In Montauban in 1944, Julien Dandieu works as a surgeon in the local hospital. Frightened by the German army entering Montauban, he asks his friend Francois to drive his wife and daughter to a back country village where Julien owns an old castle. One week later, Julien decides to go and join his family for the week end, but the Germans are already occupying the village. On his way to the house, Julien discovers the corpses of the villagers in the church, then, further away, the charred bodies of his daughter and his wife. He vows to personally kill every one of the Germans responsible in order to assuage his grief. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1975: Best actor for Philippe Noiret ; Best film for Robert Enrico ; Best music for Francois de Roubaix.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Caro ; director, Robert Enrico ; writer, Robert Enrico, Pascal Jardin, Claude Vieillot ; photography, Etienne Becker ; music, Francois de roubaix.
Cast: Romy Schneider, Philippe Noiret, Jean Bouise, Madeleine Ozeray, Catherine Delaporte.

results.title: Le Tour 1991
results.brief_description: The Tour de France is the world’s premier cycle race. In 1991 it was held over 23 days and travelled through 3,940 kms of the most spectacular French countryside culminating in the traditional last stage ride into Paris. The two videos contain the highlights of the race, interviews with top participants, descriptions of each stage of the race, a stage by stage update on the leadership table and comments by some of the fifteen million spectators.

results.title: Le Temps des Paquebots (Ep.4)
results.brief_description:
The period in between the world ward is the golden era of the great ocean liners and transatlantic carriers, with ships sucg as the Ile-de-France, Normandy, Queen Mary vying for the supreme honour of the blue ribbon. This episode also tells the famous tale of the sinking of the Titanic and includes a lenghthy interview with one of the survivors. Other topics include: Ellis Island and migration to the USA ; the transportation of troops across the Atlantic.

Credits: Directors, writers, Daniel Costelle, Jean-Marc Leblon ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu, Roland Bernard ; technical adviser, Michel Mollat.

results.title: Le Tango stupefiant
results.brief_description: This is an imaginary cabaret where songs from the past unexpectedly meet. It celebrates with irony, tenderness and sophistication, broken hearts and mysterious rugs. Simply staged and beautifully lit, the film brings together a range of music written between 1900 and 1940 by composers and lyricists as diverse as Satie, Schoenberg, Brecht and Weill, Benjamin and W.H. Auden.

results.title: Le Systeme du Docteur Terrier = Dr Terrier's System
results.brief_description:
The newly wed Vidocqs spend their honeymoon at Annette’s godfather’s. They receive a visit from strange characters whom Vidocq used to know when he was a convict in Toulon. They blackmail Vidocq into helping them with their forged money scheme.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Henri Cremieux, Jacques Dhery, Gilberte Geniat, Marion Loran, Harry Max, Jacques Seiler.

results.title: Le Soleil En Face = Face to the Sun
results.creator_credit: Stephane Tchalgadjieff, Serge Marquand, Humbert Balsan and Pierre Kast
results.brief_description:
The writer Marat has exiled himself with his family to a small Portugese village, Tavira. He is cared for by his wife, Genevieve. The family doctor informs Genevieve that Marat is dying of cancer. She tries to hide the news from her husband who manages to find out about his illness anyway. Meanwhile, a television programme extends an invitation to Marat to film a portrait.

Credits: Producers, Humbert Balsan, Serge Marquand, Stephane Tchalgadjieff ; director, Pierre Kast ; writers, Pierre Kast, Alain Aptekman ; photography, Gerard de Battista ; music, Sergio Godinho.
Cast: Jean-PIerre Cassel, Stephane Audran, Alexandra Stewart, Pierre Vaneck, Beatrice Bruno.

results.title: Le Roi et L'oiseau = the King and the Mockingbird
results.brief_description:
A despotic king kidnaps a shepherdess with whom he is in love. He forces her to marry him in return for the freedom of her true love, a chimneysweep, and his mockingbird. When they escape from prison, the king attempts to recapture them with the help of a giant robot. A first version of ‘Le roi et l’oiseau’ was released in 1952 as ‘La bergere et le ramoneur’ (The shepherdess and the Chimneysweep). Grimault and Prevert disowned this version which had been imposed to them by the producers. Ten years later, Grimault retrieved the negative and started work on a new version. Prevert died in 1970, 2 weeks after completing the film. The film was again modified between 1977 and 1979 (although many original sections were kept) to be released in France in 1980. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc 1979.

Credits: Producer, Paul Grimault ; director, Paul Grimault ; writers, Paul Grimault, Jacques Prevert ; photography, Gerard Soirant ; music, Wojcieh Kilar ; songwriter, Joseph Kosma ; set decorator, editor, Paul Grimault ; artistic advisor, Pierre Prev
Cast: Jean Martin, Pascal Mazzotti, Agnes Viala, Raymond Bussieres, Hubert Deschamps, Roger Blin, Claude Pieplu, Albert Medina. [voices only]

results.title: Le Rendez-Vous de Minuit = Rendez-Vous at Midnight
results.brief_description:
At the cinema Jacques is watching a film called ‘Rendez-vous de Minuit’ starring Lilli Palmer and Maurice Ronet. Eva, a young woman next to him, becomes emotional and rushes out of the cinema. Concerned, Jacques goes after her and she explains that her life is following the pattern of the film’s heroine and that she is to commit suicide as the character does on screen.

Credits: Producer, Jean Thuillier ; director, Roger Leenhardt ; writers, Jean-Pierre Vivet, Roger Leenhardt ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Georges Auric ; art direction, Bernard Evein ; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Lilli Palmer, Michel Auclair, Jean Galland, Maurice Ronet, Michel De Re, France Anglade, Michele Meritz, Lucienne Le Marchand, Bruno Balp, Jose Luis de Vilallonga, Robert Lombard, Daniel Emilfork.

results.title: Le Rapace = Birds of Prey
results.brief_description:
In 1938, ‘Le Rital’ is on his way to Mexico. This is not a pleasure trip. ‘Le Rital’ is a mercenary with a mission to kill the president of a South American country and to replace him with the grand-son of the former leader.

Credits: Producer, Paul Cadeac ; director, Jose Giovanni ; writer, Joser Giovanni ; photography, Pierre Petit ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Lino Ventura, Rosa Furman, Xavier Marc, Aurora Clavel, Augusto Benides.
